intro: Phacelia hastata var. charlestonensis, commonly known as Charleston phacelia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its slender, branched stems and clusters of small, sky-blue to violet flowers. The leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. This plant thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open woodlands and disturbed sites. It serves as a valuable nectar source for pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
